00035 #include <stdio.h>
00036 #include <stdlib.h>
00037 #include <stdarg.h>
00038 #include "midas.h"
00039 
00040 /*---- globals -----------------------------------------------------*/
00041 
00042 #define DEFAULT_TIMEOUT 10000   /* 10 sec. */
00043 
00044 /* Store any parameters the device driver needs in following 
00045    structure. Edit the NULLDEV_SETTINGS_STR accordingly. This 
00046    contains usually the address of the device. For a CAMAC device
00047    this could be crate and station for example. */
00048 
00049 typedef struct {
00050    int address;
00051 } NULLDEV_SETTINGS;
00052 
00053 #define NULLDEV_SETTINGS_STR "\
00054 Address = INT : 1\n\
00055 "
00056 
00057 /* following structure contains private variables to the device
00058    driver. It is necessary to store it here in case the device
00059    driver is used for more than one device in one frontend. If it
00060    would be stored in a global variable, one device could over-
00061    write the other device's variables. */
00062 
00063 typedef struct {
00064    NULLDEV_SETTINGS nulldev_settings;
00065    float *array;
00066    INT num_channels;
00067     INT(*bd) (INT cmd, ...);    /* bus driver entry function */
00068    void *bd_info;               /* private info of bus driver */
00069    HNDLE hkey;                  /* ODB key for bus driver info */
00070 } NULLDEV_INFO;
00071 
00072 /*---- device driver routines --------------------------------------*/
00073 
00074 /* the init function creates a ODB record which contains the
00075    settings and initialized it variables as well as the bus driver */
00076 
00077 INT nulldev_init(HNDLE hkey, void **pinfo, INT channels, INT(*bd) (INT cmd, ...))
00078 {
00079    int status, size;
00080    HNDLE hDB, hkeydd;
00081    NULLDEV_INFO *info;
00082 
00083    /* allocate info structure */
00084    info = calloc(1, sizeof(NULLDEV_INFO));
00085    *pinfo = info;
00086 
00087    cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
00088 
00089    /* create NULLDEV settings record */
00090    status = db_create_record(hDB, hkey, "DD", NULLDEV_SETTINGS_STR);
00091    if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
00092       return FE_ERR_ODB;
00093 
00094    db_find_key(hDB, hkey, "DD", &hkeydd);
00095    size = sizeof(info->nulldev_settings);
00096    db_get_record(hDB, hkeydd, &info->nulldev_settings, &size, 0);
00097 
00098    /* initialize driver */
00099    info->num_channels = channels;
00100    info->array = calloc(channels, sizeof(float));
00101    info->bd = bd;
00102    info->hkey = hkey;
00103 
00104    if (!bd)
00105       return FE_ERR_ODB;
00106 
00107    /* initialize bus driver */
00108    status = info->bd(CMD_INIT, info->hkey, &info->bd_info);
00109 
00110    if (status != SUCCESS)
00111       return status;
00112 
00113    /* initialization of device, something like ... */
00114    BD_PUTS("init");
00115 
00116    return FE_SUCCESS;
00117 }
00118 
00119 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00120 
00121 INT nulldev_exit(NULLDEV_INFO * info)
00122 {
00123    /* call EXIT function of bus driver, usually closes device */
00124    info->bd(CMD_EXIT, info->bd_info);
00125 
00126    /* free local variables */
00127    if (info->array)
00128       free(info->array);
00129 
00130    free(info);
00131 
00132    return FE_SUCCESS;
00133 }
00134 
00135 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00136 
00137 INT nulldev_set(NULLDEV_INFO * info, INT channel, float value)
00138 {
00139    char str[80];
00140 
00141    /* set channel to a specific value, something like ... */
00142    sprintf(str, "SET %d %lf", channel, value);
00143    BD_PUTS(str);
00144    BD_GETS(str, sizeof(str), ">", DEFAULT_TIMEOUT);
00145 
00146    /* simulate writing by storing value in local array, has to be removed
00147       in a real driver */
00148    if (channel < info->num_channels)
00149       info->array[channel] = value;
00150 
00151    return FE_SUCCESS;
00152 }
00153 
00154 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00155 
00156 INT nulldev_set_all(NULLDEV_INFO * info, INT channels, float *value)
00157 {
00158    int i;
00159    char str[100000];
00160 
00161    /* put here some optimized form of setting all channels simultaneously like ... */
00162    strcpy(str, "SETALL ");
00163    for (i = 0; i < MIN(info->num_channels, channels); i++)
00164       sprintf(str + strlen(str), "%lf ", value[i]);
00165    BD_PUTS(str);
00166    BD_GETS(str, sizeof(str), ">", DEFAULT_TIMEOUT);
00167 
00168    /* simulate writing by storing values in local array */
00169    for (i = 0; i < MIN(info->num_channels, channels); i++)
00170       info->array[i] = value[i];
00171 
00172    return FE_SUCCESS;
00173 }
00174 
00175 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00176 
00177 INT nulldev_get(NULLDEV_INFO * info, INT channel, float *pvalue)
00178 {
00179    int status;
00180    char str[80];
00181 
00182    /* read value from channel, something like ... */
00183    sprintf(str, "GET %d", channel);
00184    BD_PUTS(str);
00185    status = BD_GETS(str, sizeof(str), ">", DEFAULT_TIMEOUT);
00186 
00187    *pvalue = (float) atof(str);
00188 
00189    /* simulate reading by copying set data from local array */
00190    if (channel < info->num_channels)
00191       *pvalue = info->array[channel];
00192    else
00193       *pvalue = 0.f;
00194 
00195    return FE_SUCCESS;
00196 }
00197 
00198 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00199 
00200 INT nulldev_get_all(NULLDEV_INFO * info, INT channels, float *pvalue)
00201 {
00202    int i;
00203 
00204    /* put here some optimized form of reading all channels. If the deviced
00205       does not support such a function, one can call nulldev_get() in a loop 
00206 
00207       strcpy(str, "GETALL");
00208       BD_PUTS(str);
00209       BD_GETS(str, sizeof(str), ">", DEFAULT_TIMEOUT);
00210 
00211       for (i=0 ; i<MIN(info->num_channels, channels) ; i++)
00212       pvalue[i] = atof(str+i*5); // extract individual values from reply
00213     */
00214 
00215    /* simulate reading by copying set data from local array */
00216    for (i = 0; i < MIN(info->num_channels, channels); i++)
00217       pvalue[i] = info->array[i];
00218 
00219    return FE_SUCCESS;
00220 }
00221 
00222 /*---- device driver entry point -----------------------------------*/
00223 
00224 INT nulldev(INT cmd, ...)
00225 {
00226    va_list argptr;
00227    HNDLE hKey;
00228    INT channel, status;
00229    DWORD flags;
00230    float value, *pvalue;
00231    void *info, *bd;
00232 
00233    va_start(argptr, cmd);
00234    status = FE_SUCCESS;
00235 
00236    switch (cmd) {
00237    case CMD_INIT:
00238       hKey = va_arg(argptr, HNDLE);
00239       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00240       channel = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00241       flags = va_arg(argptr, DWORD);
00242       bd = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00243       status = nulldev_init(hKey, info, channel, bd);
00244       break;
00245 
00246    case CMD_EXIT:
00247       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00248       status = nulldev_exit(info);
00249       break;
00250 
00251    case CMD_SET:
00252       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00253       channel = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00254       value = (float) va_arg(argptr, double);   // floats are passed as double
00255       status = nulldev_set(info, channel, value);
00256       break;
00257 
00258    case CMD_SET_ALL:
00259       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00260       channel = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00261       pvalue = (float *) va_arg(argptr, float *);
00262       status = nulldev_set_all(info, channel, pvalue);
00263       break;
00264 
00265    case CMD_GET:
00266       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00267       channel = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00268       pvalue = va_arg(argptr, float *);
00269       status = nulldev_get(info, channel, pvalue);
00270       break;
00271 
00272    case CMD_GET_ALL:
00273       info = va_arg(argptr, void *);
00274       channel = va_arg(argptr, INT);
00275       pvalue = va_arg(argptr, float *);
00276       status = nulldev_get_all(info, channel, pvalue);
00277       break;
00278 
00279    default:
00280       break;
00281    }
00282 
00283    va_end(argptr);
00284 
00285    return status;
00286 }
